title: Europe's STOXX 600 rebounds in broad based gains; Stellantis plunge drags auto stocks

The index closed the week with a 1% gain, navigating AI-driven market shifts and ECB decisions.

title: 120 smallcaps deliver double-digit returns in a week. Is this the recovery everyone's looking for?
summary: Over 120 smallcap stocks posted double-digit gains in a single week, signalling a sharp rebound after months of selling pressure. While valuations have corrected and earnings remain stable in pockets, experts are divided on whether the rally marks a durable recovery or a tactical bounce driven by sentiment shifts.

title: ETMarkets Smart Talk | Why the Budget’s 4.3% fiscal deficit target is a positive for markets: Sunil Sanghai
summary: NovaaOne Capital’s Sunil Sanghai explains why the government’s 4.3% fiscal deficit target reassures markets despite revenue constraints. In this ETMarkets Smart Talk, he highlights the importance of capex-led growth, fiscal discipline, and lesser-noticed structural reforms that could support long-term capital formation.

title: Bullion’s biggest selloff: How macro shocks triggered a healthy correction in gold, silver
summary: Gold and silver saw their sharpest selloff in months as macro shocks, including a stronger US dollar, CME margin hikes and profit booking, triggered a technical correction. Experts say the fall reflects a healthy reset rather than weakening fundamentals, with long-term demand for bullion remaining intact.

title: Markets eye brighter side: Sensex, Nifty recover from early losses amid IT rout
summary: In a surprising turn of events, Indian stock markets rebounded on Friday after starting the day in the red. Traders reacted to optimistic developments surrounding a US-India trade agreement, even as apprehensions loomed over the global tech industry. Both the Nifty and Sensex climbed slightly, though the IT sector faced downturns.

title: Concurrent Gainers: 13 stocks that gain for 5 days in a row
summary: Indian equities witnessed strong momentum as the Sensex surged 3.54% over five sessions ending February 6. Amid the rally, 33 BSE 500 stocks gained consistently, with 13 delivering uninterrupted five-day advances. These stocks posted cumulative returns ranging from 10% to 21%, highlighting broad-based market strength.

title: Gold rate rebounds: Is it time to buy or should you book profits?
summary: Gold prices are experiencing volatility, with experts suggesting that buying on dips is wise. With central bank purchases at record highs and a shift in retail demand, the outlook for gold remains optimistic. Is now the right time to invest or secure profits?

title: Time to think beyond volatility? 5 mid-cap stocks from different sectors with upside potential of up to 35%
summary: At this point, there are enough reasons to be bullish and an equal number of reasons to be bearish in the stock market. To some, a no-cut in the interest rate may seem disappointing. The other way to look at it, however, is that the RBI is sure that it does not need to give a further push to growth. And that is probably why the market recovered on Friday. Can there be more global uncertainty? And can it impact the market in India? Yes, surely. But there is a macro reason why investors need to look beyond short-term liquidity issues.

title: Investor angst turns to earnings after trade clouds clear
summary: Indian stocks are navigating challenges despite trade agreements. Corporate earnings growth is lagging, and foreign investors are looking elsewhere. Recent AI advancements also impact tech giants. While trade deals offer some relief, the focus remains on strategic growth areas. Investors are cautiously optimistic about the Indian market's future.

title: Where does the capex focus lie in Union Budget 2026?
summary: Headline capex understates the Union Budget’s infrastructure push. Adjusting for equity infusions, state and private spending, and extra-budgetary resources shows effective Centre infrastructure spending rose 18% year-on-year, led by defence, transport, housing, and water, alongside PLI and targeted tax incentives.

title: India's NSE to set up unit for proposed national coal trading exchange
summary: India's National Stock Exchange has approved a new unit to manage a national coal trading platform. This platform will allow electronic trading of physical coal using standardized contracts. It aims to address price inefficiencies and improve access for smaller participants. The exchange will facilitate physical delivery and potentially derivative products in the future.

title: $40 billion blunder! South Korean crypto exchange accidentally sent 6,20,000 Bitcoins to users — Here's what happened
summary: South Korean cryptocurrency exchange Bithumb apologised after it mistakenly transferred over $40 billion worth of bitcoins to users as part of a promotion event. Almost all tokens have been recovered and the platform said it would use its own assets to cover the losses.&nbsp;

title: U.S. and India Reach Framework for Interim Trade Agreement to Boost Reciprocal Market Access and Supply Chain Resilience
summary: India will eliminate or reduce tariffs on all U.S. industrial goods and a wide range of U.S. food and agricultural products, including dried distillers grains (DDGs), red sorghum for animal feed, tree nuts, fresh and processed fruit, soybean oil, wine and spirits, and additional products.

title: Cohance Lifesciences receives warning letter from USFDA for its Hyderabad unit
summary: Cohance Lifesciences announced that the US FDA conducted an inspection at the Company's Finished Dosage Formulations manufacturing facility (FDF Unit-I) located at Nacharam, Hyderabad, from 04 August 2025 to 12 August 2025. Following the inspection, a Form FDA-483 containing six observations was issued by the US FDA. Based on these observations, the USFDA classified the facility as Official Action Indicated (OAI) and subsequently issued a Warning Letter for the said facility.

title: Strong balance sheet, brand & management are enough to create wealth: 8 stocks with upside potential from just 2% to 32%
summary: A good stock is only good in a time frame – the time frame in which it gets you returns. A good company is one which fares well even in a downturn because it has an assured market, is among the top two players in its industry, has a long growth runway, a management that has a track record, and shares wealth with its retail shareholders. Having  such companies in your portfolio increases the chance  of compounding. And creating wealth.

title: American Air CEO Agrees to Meet Pilots Union After Criticism
